commit message: Update readme for v0.07 release
Start of v0.08-dev

Fixes #25 - Colors in topic titles

Changed BufferListAdapter to use Color.stripColors instead of Color.stripIRCColors, this seems to strip colors and attributes as it should.
Added some javadoc for Color class
Added unit test for the iset case.

Fixes #25 - Colors in topic titles

Added more unit tests
Changed BufferListAdapter to use Color.stripAllColorsAndAttributes which strips message from both encodings (IRC style and WeeChat style)
Changed argument order in two of the unit tests, the expected value should be the first argument.

Fixed a javadoc error in BufferManager

@param pointer should be @param bufferName

Handling of special 0x0F mIRC color reset attribute

Due to performance reasons, this also gets stripped in the WeeChat stripColors() method. Note added in both unit test and Color class.

Added ViewHolder pattern to Adapters

This improves scrolling performance as it caches and reuses the TextView's.

Merge pull request #31 from norrs/64983114936d8b232f2764be01b9ea4c580c6d7a

Fix for #25 - Colors in topic titles (updated pull request)

Apply Apache License 2.0 to all java files.

Should have done this a while ago...

Added ViewHolder pattern to Adapters

This improves scrolling performance as it caches and reuses the TextView's.
(also ran IDEA's auto-formatting, so sorry about some ugly diffs)

Merge pull request #32 from norrs/javadoc_fix

Fixed a javadoc error in BufferManager
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:ubergeek42/weechat-android

Merging part of norrs pull request #33

Take the new test, and remove the old(invalid) testcase.

Merge remote-tracking branch 'upstream/master'

Mavenized weechat-android

Included a .gitignore files ignores 'binaries'
Maven POM files and checkstyle.xml based on ActionBarSherlock's project files. They work like a charm \:D/
(nb: disbaled checkstyle atm, as we need to agree on some styling etc, maybe convert ubergeek42 over to IntelliJ IDEA so we can simply use auto code-formatting without hassling to get it right between IDE's)
Fixes broken code in weechat-relay-example
Maven changes: proper version in dependency and added weechat-relay-example

Mavenized weechat-android

Included a .gitignore files ignores 'binaries'
Maven POM files and checkstyle.xml based on ActionBarSherlock's project files. They work like a charm \:D/
(nb: disbaled checkstyle atm, as we need to agree on some styling etc, maybe convert ubergeek42 over to IntelliJ IDEA so we can simply use auto code-formatting without hassling to get it right between IDE's)
Maven changes: proper version in dependency and added weechat-relay-example

Added required res directory

res directory is required for maven to build properly
Fixes broken code in weechat-relay-example

Mavenize things!

Remove old ant build tools.
Re-organize maven/clean up pom.xml files

Remove unused things

Eclipse workspace, and binary libraries.  This all comes from maven now.

Modify maven some more

Make it create release builds by running mvn -P release(These get
signed/aligned)

More maven changes

Fixed an issue with quicktag not working on eclipse
Added test directories(makes eclipse happy)
Fixed dependencies
Added project.properties file for weechat-relay

Sort bufferlist on buffer change on highlights and then unread lines. Fixes #35

Signed-off-by: Keith Johnson <kj@ubergeek42.com>

Merge buffer sorting from torhve

Additionally added a preference for it(I'm not sure I'll use it)
Minor code cleanup extracting the comparator to a private variable.
Fixes #35
Closes #38

Fix extended colors

The mapping of the extended colors was being done stupidly before,
resulting in all gray nicks for anything outside the standard weechat
colors. This fixes them to map directly to what the terminal colors
should be(I think).  It looks much better to me now anyway.

Fixes #37

Add blank/default GitVersion file

Prevents compilation errors for people not using maven.
Start of hotlist implementation. Still todo to keep track of changes.
Only add msg and highlight to hotlist

Implement hotlist update on buffer line added.

It syncs with initial hotlist, but still needs removal from hotlist when
you switch to buffer.
Add preference for datetime format. Fixes #24

Fix bug in Preferences screen

It wasn't updating the value when changing(used the wrong preference
name)
Closes #42
Fixes #24
let volume keys handle font resize

Text size change with volume keys

Made chatline update textsize every time it renders(rather than once per
convertview).  This means we don't have to recreate the activity to
update text size.
Modified xt's commit to only change on volume button keydown, otherwise
it was happening twice.
Added min/max text sizes(just to prevent issues)

Closes #40

Updated readme with build status icon

Now I'm encouraged to not break the build.

Removed build status icon

It was only visible to me when logged in.

Merge branch 'upstream' into maven

Conflicts:
pom.xml
weechat-android/pom.xml
weechat-relay-example/pom.xml
weechat-relay/pom.xml

Poor man error handling

At least give some form for feedback if hostname is invalid etc.
Better merging. Remove item from hotlist when switched to buffer.

Target SDK Version changed to JELLY_BEAN

SDK version changed to 16, targeting Android 4.1, 4.1.1 (code name JELLY_BEAN)

Updated gitignore to ignore GitVersion.java

This file is autogenerated by maven, let's just add it to ignore and keep some static default values saying 'not built by maven' for those who are not using maven and keep the dummy file in repo
Optimize removal
GitVersion , revert to default values as used in commit 49a4e56b714019179614ca933926028e83ae618f
Bigger hotlist items
Try to fix the bug with hotlist and item0
Start of fragment work

Fix tab completion

Fix crash when trying to tab complete an empty line
Require only a single character to start tab completion

Add SSH Tunnel Support

Now connecting through an SSH tunnel is possible.
Preferences screen reorganized(If you were using stunnel, you will have
to change the 'connection type' to stunnel in the connection settings)
Extracted some common post connection code to its own function.

Fixes #27

Removing menu-button-context and adds ActionBar actions for Menu and Hotlist

Following Google's advise that menu button navigation should be available in ActionBar instead for tablet users.
Started on Hotlist to be available from ActionBar. This works almost as it should, but need to force updating connectionStatus title in onPrepareOptionsMenu.
(button works, but wrong label, doesn't get updated)
Swapped out 'native' ActionBar with ActionBarSherlock to be compatible with pre-3.0
Fix two pane layout for bufferlist and buffer.

StrictMode for developers and async fix for toggling connection

Connecting/Disconnecting was happening on main thread, now runs in a asynctask.
Remove deleted

Merge branch 'async_connecting'

Make getChar and peek methods thread safe in Color class
Merged xt-hotlist, strictmode_fixes with local master

weechat-android/src/com/ubergeek42/WeechatAndroid/WeechatActivity.java
weechat-android/src/com/ubergeek42/WeechatAndroid/WeechatChatviewActivity.java
Forgot to add layout-land folder
Merge remote-tracking branch 'xt/fragments' into fragments
Merged xt/fragments and upstream/master
Fixe case in manifest, it messes with eclipse building
Try to improve settings
update .gitignore
Merge remote-tracking branch 'norrs/fragments'
Fix hotlist clicking to use fragments instead of activity
Remove buffer from hotlist when switched to

Add support for Array protocol object

Adjusted build files so weechat-relay only uses the slf4j-api.
Modified weechat-relay to be useful again
Created a TestMessageHandler class to parse/rpint the messages from
sending the command 'test'.

Implement nicklist viewing, for now as dialog

Want to make this into a fragment eventually
Fix both portrait and landscape fragment
Disable layout swapping on portrait/land
Adding action bar icons from Android dev. icon pack.
Fix NPEs in the buffer title using StringBuilder
Reverting back to how actionbar layout was before
Merge remote-tracking branch 'norrs/actionbar_fixes'
Remove chatviewactivity, move keyboard hidden to main activity
Fix hotlist sorting to be more like weechat default
Fix sorting
Display check for hotlist
Cleanup changes necessary for inclusion
Remove build error
Forgot a few files

Fixed issue with BufferList not updating

The relayservice was only allowing one 'client' to be notified of
onconnect/disconnect messages.  This change allows any number of
'clients' to receive these messages.

Fix title when entering/leaving buffers

Also fixed problem running on tablets.
Made NickListFragment extend the Sherlock variant.

Close the buffer when it closes server side

We simply pop whatever was on the backstack off.  This doesn't work
right on a tablet since there is no bufferlist to pop back to.

Merge remote-tracking branch 'upstream/master' into array_tags

Conflicts:
weechat-android/pom.xml
Try and fix new array tags
Fix array_tags parsing and ignore unimportant tags for hotlist updates

Fix connection state in actionbarmenu

Now it shows disconnected/connected state properly in actionbar menu. Problem was that service binding could be null when onPreapreOptionsMenu got triggered, hence we store reference to actionbar menu in onCreateOptionsMenu instead and update context whenever we need to from events like onConnect etc.
update connection state from onDisconnect event
Layout improvements
Improve titles in hotlist and nicklist

Make weechat-relay a normal jar instead of apklib

There is no reason for it to be an apklib, and it is causing problems in
eclipse by being one.  So now it is back to just being a normal jar.

Removed some android specific stuff from the library.  This library is
intended for general use, so android specific things will not be
accepted into it.

Fix error in LineHandler

Need to check type before assuming it is an array.  This prevents
breakage on pre 3.9 weechats.  Also modified getType() slightly.

Prevent network on main thread

Cleanup RelayConnection to not use any network IO in main thread.  This
is an android StrictMode exception.  Also some minor
cleanup(remove/rename a variable)
Move sorting and listening from adapter to the fragment, and remember selected item after sort

Cleanup BufferListAdapter/Fragment

Cleanup the initial commit reorganizing these things.
Add ability to hide server buffers. Added a preference for it too.

Merge in a few of torhve's fixes

Catch another exception.
Initialize bufferadapter on connect.
Merge remote-tracking branch 'upstream/fragment_wip'
Save the tags for each line to the BufferLine in the linehandler
Implement logic for deciding if line recieved should count as unread or not
Request notify levels from buffers, check for 'None'-type and do not add lines as unread if they are added to such buffers
Sync the weechat hotlist counters to the bufferlist
Bugfix: Check if type is actually set on buffer before check for removal
Bugfix: NullPointerException if getLocalVar is called before local vars has been set.
Improve layout for swp600dp, padding everywhere.
Add menu for hiding/unhiding bufferlist
Merge commit '38c9270027843e186990cfa12986c5bc03306a8d' into fragment_wip
Merge remote-tracking branch 'norrs/master' into fragment_wip

Bugfixes/Cleanup

Remove unused imports in a few places.
Prevent updateMenuContext from crashing if called without a menu
Keep track of fragment attached state in BufferListFragment
Remove connectionhandler when we unbind from the service in
BufferListFragment
Call onBuffersChanged during onConnect() in BufferListFragment, to fix
list not being rendered.
Notify that hotlist has changed when an item is removed from it
Add a few typechecks to ensure we don't do something bad

Handle tags in the hotlisthandler.

Fixes the bug that you get notification when you open a private buffer
and weechat adds old lines from the log. These are tagged properly, so
we can filter them out with our newfound ability to read tags
Add Norwegian l10n

Rework interaction between Fragments and Activity

Cleanup in NickListAdapter
Modify WeechatActivity to hold a pointer to the current Fragment being
displayed.  This is then used to get the nicklist, buffer title, etc.
When a fragment is 'attached' it updates this pointer in the activity.
Merge remote-tracking branch 'torhve/fragment_wip' into fragment_wip

Fix nicklist showing up on bufferlist

Check for nicks==null when looking at the nicklist.  This happens when
channels/buffers don't have a nicklist(or it is empty).  This fixes a
crash.

Add onActivityCreated in BufferListFragment to call setCurrentFragment
as onAttach wasn't getting called at the right time.

Remove ChatViewActivity

Fixed RelayService to launch the main activity on notifications.
Fixed main activity to accept an argument for a buffer to load; this
supports notifications.

Change dos to unix line endings

Stupid cleanup commit which will hopefully make merging into master a
bit easier.

Remove change that conflicts with master.

Shouldn't even be here anyway(it only exists to make a test case pass)

Fix nick completion

Merge with master to apply the correct nick completion changes.

Reorganize Preferences pane

Part of preparation for merge to master

Remove bufferlist toggle if not tablet

It will only confuse the user at this point.  In the future we may bring
this back depending on how the layout changes.

Fix exception when closing buffer

There is no need to call removeObserver when the buffer is being closed.
That will happen automatically.  This fixes a concurrent modification
exception when a buffer is closed(e.g. user typed /close)

Fix a few crashes

Related to closing a buffer/clicking notification to launch app.

Fix a few force closes

Closing a buffer in weechat with nothing left on the backstack.  Not
sure why the BufferFragment still exists(Presumably should go away when
they navigate back to the bufferlist) Either way this should still apply
to tablets.

Fix crash with BufferListFragment trying to update when not visible.

Perform message sending in a new thread

This prevents any main thread from blocking on send.  Fixes an issue
with the android client and strictmode.

Fix notification icons on ICS

Add new icons for notifications
Use Notification.Builder instead of the old deprecated new
Notification()
Change pendingIntent flags to replace the activity, this prevents
clicking on a the base notification and being returned to a buffer
instead of the buffer list.

Make notifications work when the app is open

If the app is open, and you click a notification, it should take you to
the proper location.  This code handles the intents properly when this
occurs.

Reorganize layout

Now both the tablet and phone have a bufferlistfragment and
bufferfragment available at all times.  On the phone layout these are
simply toggled with hide/show.
Removed the empty textview in chatview_main(it wasn't working right)

Make buffer_fragment a frame instead of a fragment

If the fragment is declared in the xml as it was, then when you
.replace() it in a transaction, and then rotate the device you will
experience a crash. This commit changes it so that the fragment is
dynamically added to the layout.
Also fixed the functionality of the # button on tablets/phones. I wasn't
thinking when I wrote that part.

Add placeholder text if no buffer is loaded

Load a view if there is nothing to display, telling the user to select a
buffer from the list.

Forgot to commit a change

Add an ID to the layout for chatview so the contents can be replaced
with the view we want.

Force default colors

On some devices, the background/text colors on the dialogs for hotlist
and nicklist are very hard to read.  This forces a default gray
background with white text, so at least it will be readable.

Fix counts of messages in hotlist/bufferlist

In the hotlist, it should be the max of unread/highlights.
In the bufferlist, it should simply show unread and highlights, not the
difference between them.

Fix back button not going back to bufferlist

If in a buffer, now pressing back will return you to the bufferlist.
Pressing back while at the bufferlist will close the activity.

Make sure title is correct

Update the title whenever the current visible buffer changes.
There is propably an opportunity for some refactoring here.

Update project.properties

Just something more reasonable than what it used to be.

Formatting the code

Applied code formatting.  Line length limit of 100, no trailing spaces,
no tabs, 4 spaces per indent, always use braces(and some others).

Included my eclipse formatter definition, and eclipse cleanup definition
in the 'releases' directory.

Fix bug with preferences display

ssh port was not updating in the preferences screen when it was changed.
Fixes #49

Fix a couple of crashes

Fix crash when buffer is closed while in it(with /wc or /buffer close).
Fixes #48 I think.

Possibly fix a bug where the hotlist isn't loaded yet we try to use
it(Very hard to reproduce).

Update scrolling behaviour in buffer view

Lines now fill in from the bottom
If you are scrolled back reading, your view will not be reset to the
bottom when a new message is received.  This is the 'transcript mode' of
a listview.

I did notice that my android 2.3 emulator does not play nicely with this
when sending messages(but when receiving it works fine).  Might just be
an emulator bug.

Fixes #44.

Add support for Weechat SSL

Support SSL directly through the weechat relay plugin.
This implementation does no certificate checking, which is potentially
bad.

Add SSL Certificate Verification

Instead of trusting everything, ask the user to specifically accept SSL
certificates.
New activity created to support this action.
Added button on 'About' page to clear all trusted certs.
Modified error handling of connections so we can pass the 'Untrusted'
certificate around.
RelayService manages the app specific keystore
Exposed a few new functions to the RelayServiceBinder to support the
workflow of accepting a certificate
Cleaned up a few comments

Fix SSL handling to properly use our own keystore

Tiny bit of cleanup, and making it actually use your custom keystore

Put everything in a ViewPager

Allow more than one buffer open at a time
Swipe left/right through buffers
Known issues: breaks tablet support

Let the OS determine whether to use IPv6 or IPv4

InetAddress.getByName will return an IPv6 address if a AAAA record
exists regardless of whether or not the OS supports IPv6. Instead, let
the Socket figure out which address to use.

Fix crash with Android 3.0+

IO on the main thread is an exception on these versions of Android.
Move the code into a new thread so we don't crash when exiting.
Merge remote-tracking branch 'mhoran/fix-ipv6-crash'

Fix crash when clicking nicklist button

Used to crash on BufferList, and not work when in a buffer.
Due to poor logic in an if statement

Fix tablet mode to use viewpager

Redo the tablet support that was broken with the change to viewpager
Remove a few old layout files
Remove 'highlighting' buffers in the list in tablet mode.

Fix crash when clicking before connection

If not connected to the server, the message 'click menu->connect to
connect' is displayed.  Clicking on this used to crash.

Fix color handling

Setting the foreground/background color should only accept one color
value, not two.  This results in a crash if the color is followed by a
comma.
Also stop the sillyness of the singleton/synchronization stuff.
Performance doesn't seem to be affected that much.

Support SSH Keyfile based authentication

Added new preference for specifying an ssh private key file
Changed wording for the password option.
Add a logger for Jsch so we can see what is going on
Note: on android keys larger than 1024 bits are untested(2048 crashes)
Fixes #45

Slightly better error handling

Pops up a toast notification with the exception summary when it crashes
on connection.  Not the most useful messages, but at least they aren't
crashes.
Fix size of send button

Added button for tab completion

Can toggle visibility of send button
Can toggle visibility of tab completion button
Button added to perform tab completion
Fixed potential issue where tab completion was still 'in progress' after
using the send button(rather than the enter button).

Change default to hide server buffers

They are rarely useful, and this is a better default
Version bump
